abstract.text: An abstract superclass to all synchronized view controllers, that displays a task
and its events.

inlineContent.text: This abstract superclass has a factory function that you can use to conveniently

abstract.text: Create apps that help people better understand and manage their health.
A task controller that keeps a record of events, sorted by their dates.
A view controller that displays multiple events in a grid collection view.
A view controller that displays and updates a single event, which can be completed
or uncompleted by tapping a large button.
A controller object that watches, and updates tasks.
A protocol that tracks and updates the state of a task.
An abstract superclass to all synchronized view controllers, that displays a task
and its events.
An object that handles interacting with data from the store.
An object that handles important events inside a view controller.
Notifies the delegate a task view has been selected.
Creates a new task view controller with a specific controller and synchronizer.
Initialize a view controller that displays a task. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the task.
Creates a new task view controller for a specific task, with an event query to limit
the results from the store.
Initialize a view controller that displays a task. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the task.
Initialize a view controller that displays a task. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the task.
Initialize a view controller that displays a task. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the task.
Initialize a view controller that displays task. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the task.
Initialize a view controller that displays task. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the task.
Creates a new task view controller with a specific task identifier and event query.
Initialize a view controller that displays task. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the task.
Initialize a view controller that displays task. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the task.
Initialize a view controller that displays tasks. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the tasks.
Initialize a view controller that displays tasks. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the tasks.
Initialize a view controller that displays tasks. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the tasks.
Creates a new task view controller with an array of specific task identifiers, and
event query.
Initialize a view controller that displays tasks. Fetches and stays synchronized with events for the tasks.
Creates a new task view controller with a specific synchronizer, task, and query.
Creates a new task view controller with a specific task identifier, synchronizer,
and query.
Creates a new task view controller with an array of specific task identifiers, synchronizer,
and query.
The view that displays task data.
Called when an event is completed.
Called when an outcome value has been created at a particular index.
Called when an outcome value was selected for a particular event.
An object that handles updating the view when data in the store changes.
A protocol for handling changes in events inside a view controller.
A protocol that handles creating and updating type-erased view synchronizers for
tasks.
Display tasks to users.
A view that displays a header, multi-line label, a collection of log buttons, and
a dynamic vertical stack of logged items.
A view that displays multiple events for a single task, in a vertically stacked checklist
of items.
A cell the grid collection view uses to show completion of the underlying event.
A view that displays multiple events for a single task, with each event displaying
a header, grid of buttons, and a multi-line label.
A view that displays a header, multi-line label, and a completion button.
A collection view cell that displays a button for logging tasks.
The base class for all log views, that shows a header view and a dynamic stack view
of log items.
A view that displays a header view and a circular checkmark button.
A protocol that handles events related to a task-displayable object.
